rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C90003

definition: Terminology relevant to the type of nonclinical study performed.
name: SEND Study Type
synonyms: SEND Study Type

terms.definition: The branch of pharmacokinetics that studies the process by which a drug is absorbed by the body.
synonyms: FDA RPS Pharmacokinetics: Absorption

terms.definition: A study that is designed to investigate the absorption, distribution, metabolism and excretion of a drug.
synonyms: Absorption, Distribution, Metabolism and Excretion

terms.definition: An indication or description of the process by which the truth of something is tested or found.
synonyms: FDA RPS Analytical Methods And Validation Reports

terms.definition: A toxicity study that assesses the ability of a substance to induce an antigenic response in an animal.
synonyms: FDA RPS Other Toxicity Studies: Antigenicity

terms.definition: A study of the degree to which or rate at which a drug or other substance is absorbed or becomes available at the site of physiological activity after administration. (NCI)
A study that assesses the toxic effects of a compound in animals after repeated administrations with particular emphasis on determining the carcinogenicity of the compound.
synonyms: FDA RPS Toxicology: Carcinogenicity

terms.definition: The study of the effects of drugs upon the heart or circulatory system.
The branch of pharmacology that deals with the central nervous system. (NCI)
A study that assesses the capacity of a substance to become an abuse liability.
synonyms: FDA RPS Other Toxicity Studies: Dependence

terms.definition: The branch of pharmacokinetics that studies the process by which a drug is distributed by the body.
synonyms: FDA RPS Pharmacokinetics: Distribution

terms.definition: A study that assesses the efficacy of prophylactic treatment given after exposure to the challenge agent(s) but before the manifestation of the disease or condition.
A study that assesses the efficacy of a radiomitigator (given after exposure to the challenge agent(s) but before the manifestation of the disease or condition).
A study that assesses the efficacy of prophylactic treatment (including radioprotectors) given before exposure to the challenge agent(s).
A study that assesses the efficacy of treatment given after a protocol-defined manifestation of the challenge agent(s)-induced disease or condition.
A toxicity study that assesses the effects of a substance on embryonic and fetal development.
terms.preferredTerm: Reproductive and Developmental Toxicity: Embryofetal Development
synonyms: FDA RPS Reproductive And Developmental Toxicity: Embryofetal Development

terms.definition: The branch of pharmacokinetics that studies the process by which a drug is eliminated by the body.
synonyms: FDA RPS Pharmacokinetics: Excretion

terms.definition: A study that assesses the effects of a substance on an organism's fertility and/or embryonic development.
terms.preferredTerm: Reproductive and Developmental Toxicity: Fertility and Early Embryonic Development
synonyms: FDA RPS Reproductive And Developmental Toxicity: Fertility And Early Embryonic Development

terms.definition: The branch of pharmacology that deals with the gastrointestinal system. (NCI)
A genotoxicity study that tests the ability of a substance to cause DNA damage not in intact animals, but in cells or other systems.
synonyms: FDA RPS Genotoxicity: In Vitro

terms.definition: A genotoxicity study that tests the ability of a substance to cause DNA damage within the body.
synonyms: FDA RPS Genotoxicity: In Vivo

terms.definition: A toxicity study that assesses potential harm to the immune system.
synonyms: FDA RPS Other Toxicity Studies: Immunotoxicity

terms.definition: A study that assesses the effects of impurities that may be found in a substance.
synonyms: FDA RPS Other Toxicity Studies: Impurities

terms.definition: A toxicology study that assesses the effects of a substance on a subject that received treatment and/or was dosed beginning during the juvenile stage of development.
terms.preferredTerm: Studies in which the Offspring (Juvenile Animals) are Dosed and/or Further Evaluated
synonyms: FDA RPS Studies In Which The Offspring (Juvenile Animals) Are Dosed And/Or Further Evaluated

terms.definition: A toxicology study that assesses the effects of a substance when administered to a restricted portion of the body.
synonyms: FDA RPS Toxicology: Local Tolerance

terms.definition: A study that investigates the process by which a substance induces its effects.
synonyms: FDA RPS Other Toxicity Studies: Mechanistic Studies

terms.definition: The branch of pharmacokinetics that studies the process by which a drug is metabolized by the body.
synonyms: FDA RPS Pharmacokinetics: Metabolism

terms.definition: A study that evaluates the effects of a metabolite of a substance.
synonyms: FDA RPS Other Toxicity Studies: Metabolites

terms.definition: A study that monitors the development and progression of a disease or condition.
A study to test whether certain biological agents (e.g., viruses) or materials (e.g., nucleic acids) are capable of immortalizing cells and endowing them with the capacity to form tumors.
The branch of pharmacology that deals with the mechanism of action and biochemical and physiological effects of drug-drug interactions.
synonyms: FDA RPS Pharmacology: Pharmacodynamic Drug Interactions

terms.definition: The branch of pharmacokinetics that studies the process by which two or more drugs in a system are absorbed, distributed, metabolized, and eliminated by the body.
synonyms: FDA RPS Pharmacokinetics: Drug Interactions

terms.definition: A study that assesses a toxic response from a substance which is either elicited or increased (apparent at lower dose levels) after subsequent exposure to light, or that is induced by skin irradiation after systemic administration of a substance (adapted from OECD Guideline for Testing of Chemicals, copyright OECD, 2004, TG 432).
A toxicity study that assesses the effects of a substance on an organism's development shortly before and after birth.
terms.preferredTerm: Reproductive and Developmental Toxicity: Prenatal and Postnatal Development Including Maternal Function
synonyms: FDA RPS Reproductive And Developmental Toxicity: Prenatal And Postnatal Development Including Maternal Function

terms.definition: The branch of pharmacology that deals with the biochemical and physiological effects of a drug and the mechanism of drug action in relation to its desired therapeutic target.
synonyms: FDA RPS Pharmacology: Primary Pharmacodynamics

terms.definition: The science concerned with drugs and their actions and uses in kidney biology and the treatment of kidney disease. (NCI)
A study that assesses the toxic effects of a compound in animals after repeated administrations.
terms.preferredTerm: Toxicology: Repeat Dose Toxicity [Species, Route, Duration]
synonyms: FDA RPS Toxicology: Repeat Dose Toxicity

terms.definition: The branch of pharmacology that deals with the respiratory system. (NCI)
The branch of pharmacology that deals with the biochemical and physiological effects of a drug and the mechanism of drug action not related to its desired therapeutic target.
synonyms: FDA RPS Pharmacology: Secondary Pharmacodynamics

terms.definition: A study that assesses the toxic effects of a compound in animals after a single administration.
terms.preferredTerm: Toxicology: Single Dose Toxicity [Species and Route]
synonyms: FDA RPS Toxicology: Single Dose Toxicity

terms.definition: Evaluation of the absorption, distribution, metabolism and excretion of a substance in relation to its toxicity in an animal.
A study in which immortalized cells form tumors when inoculated into animals.
